p:
The median Cqs differed regarding the environment where carcasses were collected ( x
2 = 57.19, p< 0.0001) ( Table 3). Lower median Cqs (higher estimated YFV genomic loads) were observed for carcasses collected in rural areas (median Cq = 13.0) compared to carcasses from urban-rural interface (median Cq = 31.5) ( Table 3), and urban areas (median Cq = 32.6) (p = 0.0026 and p< 0.0001, respectively). Regarding the genera, analyses of median Cqs among Alouatta (median Cq = 13.0), Callicebus (median Cq = 8.5), and Callithrix (median Cq = 32.0) indicated a significant difference ( x
2 = 31.86, p< 0.0001) ( Table 3). Differences in median Cqs were observed for total Callithrix compared to Alouatta (p< 0.001) and to Callicebus (p = 0.0045). Finally, for one specimen of Sapajus nigritus, Cq of 30.2 (estimate of 3.10E+04 gc/g liver) was observed.
